title: What's an easier way to 'patent' an idea if you can't afford the expensive difficult process? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not exactly a patent but when you write a book (in essence anything you write) is automatically covered by copyright What I am writing here is covered. If someone copies in a copy / paste else where manner, and claim that they are / were the originator of said text, they are breaking the copyright law. If they take part in a Michael said quote they are safe So write a book, get published, no expensive difficult process involved Good luck

Protect the idea as a Trade Secret. Don’t tell anyone about it who absolutely doesn’t have a need to know, mark any paperwork with details about the idea as Secret; keep them in a secure location; etc. Consult an Intellectual Property attorney licensed in your location for guidance as to how to implement a Trade Secret program relating to your specific idea(s) in your country, in your situation (i.e., can you do everything in-house, or do you have to rely on outside vendors, and how do you deal with them to maintain your Trade Secret secret.

An idea cannot be patented, only a sufficiently detailed description of an implementation of the idea. Investigate whether the German Utility Model Protection mechanism would be useful to you. It is inexpensive, but its protection is limited, and even that is limited to Germany.
